intro: Ptilotrichum angustifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaf ptilotrichum, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and thrives in shaded to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, and the flowers are usually pink or white, appearing in spring. Ptilotrichum angustifolium is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
